In Syria, a cycle of revenge engulfs the Druze city of Sweida
subhead: Attacks against Druze civilians, allegedly carried out by members of government forces, have multiplied in recent days in the city of Sweida and its surrounding areas, which remain cut off from the outside world. These attacks have triggered retaliatory violence against Bedouins.

title: EU agrees 18th round of Russia sanctions over Ukraine war
French troops leave Senegal, but Dakar maintains ties with Paris
subhead: At the request of Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye, all French military bases in Senegal have now been handed over. Unlike how France withdrew from other Sahel countries, the departure took place without any rift between the two states.

title: Witnesses recount horrific conditions inside the Wagner Group's secret detention centers in Mali
subhead: Le Monde, in collaboration with Forbidden Stories and media partners, investigated arbitrary arrests of Malians by Russian mercenaries. The investigation reveals the existence of at least six bases where detainees were illegally held and secretly subjected to persecution.
byline: By Thomas Eydoux and Julian Mathews

title: In Rome, the re-enchanted gardens of the Villa Medici
subhead: As famous as the Renaissance palace they surround, the gardens of the French Academy in Italy have just been redesigned by artists and landscape architects. Initiated by the director of the institution, this enhancement of the botanical heritage highlights citrus trees, the emblematic fruits of the area.

title: These French villages have no more drinking water. The reason? PFAS pollution
subhead: Nearly 3,500 residents across 16 rural villages have been unable to drink tap water since July 10 due to a record-breaking contamination by PFAS, a group of toxic substances known as 'forever chemicals.'
byline: By Stéphane Mandard (Blagny, La Ferté-sur-Chiers, Villy, Han-lès-Juvigny and Stenay (eastern France), special correspondent)

In Arles, Fragonard's Museum of Fashion and Costume gracefully unveils treasures
subhead: With a collection of 20,000 garments and accessories, the Musée Fragonard de la Mode et du Costume opened its doors on July 6. Housed in the former Bouchaud de Bussy mansion, which the architects of Studio KO have shaped into a Provençal jewel box, the museum showcases three centuries of traditional dress history.

title: In 1945, 'Elle' instantly set a new standard for French women's magazines
subhead: 'The Summer of 1945' (4/6). Hélène Gordon-Lazareff, who spent much of World War Two in the United States, returned to France with fresh ideas for the press. She promised her readers 'seriousness in frivolity, irony in gravity.'

title: Gaza: Video verified by Le Monde shows gunfire near food distribution center
subhead: The video was filmed in Rafah, nearly 900 meters from a Gaza Humanitarian Foundation aid distribution center. According to the United Nations, over 800 people have been killed in Gaza since the end of May while trying to access humanitarian aid.
byline: By Juliette Prigent, Asia Balluffier, Elisa Bellanger and Julian Mathews
